alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued November 08 at 11:33AM AKST until November 08 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING FOR THOMPSON PASS... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 28 inches through Wednesday evening. Northeast winds gusting 30 to 45 mph. * WHERE...Thompson Pass. * WHEN...Until 9 PM AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult. Widespread falling and blowing snow will produce whiteout conditions at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will rise to as high as 2400 feet Wednesday afternoon, confining blizzard conditions to near the top of the pass.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
